item.title: Referral for prosecution in Egypt over $1bn African football TV deal angers Caf - The Guardian
item.description:
Referral for prosecution in Egypt over $1bn African football TV deal angers Caf  The Guardian

The Confederation of African Football has been referred for prosecution in Egypt over the sale of its worldwide television rights for the next 12 years at a price said to be worth $1bn. The president of Caf, Issa Hayatou, a former acting president of Fifa, does not appear to have been referred for prosecution personally; Caf said initial reports that he had were “false”, while insisting the confederation has committed no offence in relation to its TV deals. Related: The Premier League’s likely winners and losers from 2017 Africa Cup of Nations | Paul Doyle The Egyptian Competition Authority...

item.title: Five people dead and seven injured after crowd stampede at African Champions League match in Angola - The Independent
item.description:
Five people dead and seven injured after crowd stampede at African Champions League match in Angola  The Independent

Five people were killed and seven injured in a stampede after an African Champions League match in the Angolan capital Luanda on Saturday, the sports ministry said. Witnesses told Reuters the people were crushed to death when they flooded out of the stadium after the game between Angola's Primeiro de Agosto and TP Mazembe from the Democratic Republic of Congo, which according to local reports was attended by a capacity crowd of 50,000 spectators. - Read more 'At least one dead and 37 injured' in Madagascar football stampede Angola's sports ministry said in a statement late on Sunday that it...

item.title: Morocco beat Nigeria in CHAN final – the major international tournament you've probably never heard of - The Independent
item.description:
Morocco beat Nigeria in CHAN final – the major international tournament you've probably never heard of  The Independent

At the end, the overwhelmed Moroccan players waited in the heavy rain to collect their winners’ medals from the 14-year-old Crown Prince Hassan. Some were brave enough to ask him for a selfie. After he had left the pitch at the Stade Mohammed V, named after his great-grandfather, the real celebrations could begin. There were fireworks, but most of all the tens of thousands of fans who had braved the rain just wanted to see their players with the trophy. It was the first Morocco had won since 1976. You may never have heard of CHAN and you are unlikely to have ever seen any of these players p...

item.title: Mo Salah’s African award just another step in his quest for a place in history - The Guardian
item.description:
Mo Salah’s African award just another step in his quest for a place in history  The Guardian

“Where do you get these rumours from?” Sadio Mané asked incredulously. The pilot of the private charter carrying him and his Liverpool team-mate Mohamed Salah for the African Footballer of the Year awards on Thursday had just asked if the two had any bad blood between them. “Did you see the assist I gave him in our last game [against Leicester at Anfield]?” Mané asked the pilot. And a few hours later, the Senegalese would tell the Guardian: “Mo and me are very, very good friends. He is maybe my best friend in Liverpool even though I am cool with everyone.” Related: Jürgen Klopp says Mohamed...
